title: Drawing, "Ulysesses Discovers Achilles in Scyros", ca. 1790
medium: Pen and brown ink over traces of graphite on light blue laid paper
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors
description: Ulysses sits at right at table, at whose other end Achilles stands in garb of maiden, holding a helmet and sword. Frightened Deidamia speaks him. Six more girls are shown.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Ulysesses Discovers Achilles in Scyros", ca. 1790.
ca. 1790. Pen and brown ink over traces of graphite on light blue laid paper. Museum purchase through gift of various donors. 1901-39-3290.
